intro: Bonamia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
